simphony.settings

Class SettingsIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • simphony.settings.SettingsIO

  • public class SettingsIO
extends java.lang.Object
    This handles IO operations on SettingsRegistrys. It does not handle converting between different implementations of SettingsRegistrys, so you cannot serialize one implementation and read it in with a different implementation.
    Author:
    Jerry Vos

    • Method Detail

      • loadSettings

        public static SettingsRegistry loadSettings(java.lang.String registryId,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
        This loads from the specified file a SettingsRegistry. If the file does not exist this will return a new SettingsRegistry with the given id, otherwise it will load one from the specified file and set its id to be the specified id.

        If the registry has already been loaded this will return the previously loaded one. As with the store methods, this will not attempt to reload the next registry in the chain.

        Parameters:
        registryId - the id for the registry
        fileName - the name of the file that the registry may be loaded from
        Returns:
        a registry with the specified id

      • storeSettings

        public static void storeSettings(SettingsRegistry registry,
                 java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Stores the specified registry to the specified file.

        This will not store the pointer to the next registry, nor will it store the next registry itself.

        Parameters:
        registry - the registry to store
        fileName - the name of the file to store the registry to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
